snippet: The English versions of the Nobel Prize winner Tomas Transtromer’s poems raise issues that go to the heart of the translator’s function.
abstract: David Orr On Poetry essay notes that three different translations of works by Swedish poet Tomas Transtromer have been released or reissued since he won the Nobel Prize in 2011; The Deleted World: Poems, translated by Robin Robertson, Tomas Transtromer: Selected Poems, edited by Robert Hass and For the Living and the Dead: Poems and a Memoir, edited by Daniel Halperin, join two major collections already in print.
lead_paragraph: The English versions of the Nobel Prize winner Tomas Transtromer’s poems raise issues that go to the heart of the translator’s function.

headline.seo: Tomas Transtromer’s Poems and the Art of Translation
